titlestmt.titleproper: Congregational Library & Archives Artwork collection, 1770-1998, undated.
titlestmt.author: Zachary Bodnar, Billy McCarthy

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday June 21, 2023 at 17:38

did.unittitle: Congregational Library & Archives Artwork collection, 1770-1998, undated.
did.abstract: This collection was formed in 2023 as a way to quickly see all of the artwork that is in the Congregational Library & Archives. The list will likely see growth as we identify pieces of artwork located elsewhere in the collection or with the purchase of new pieces. This collections contains 51 pieces of artwork. A majoirty of the 51 pieces are portraits, but the collection also includes architectural drawings and a bust.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: For both preservation and display purposes, many of the pieces of artwork have been framed. Framed pieces at the CLA will not be removed from their frames without the express permission of the Executive Director.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Congregational Library & Archives Artwork collection, 1770-1998, undated, RG5459. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The items within this collection have accumulated over the history of the organization and many lack clear acquisition information. When their is information on the source of acquisition, it will be noted under the individual item. An example of this can be seen with the Nancy E. Forsberg portrait.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Billy McCarthy June 2023, using DACS second edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: This collection was formed in 2023 as a way to quickly see all of the artwork that is in the Congregational Library & Archives. The list will likely see growth as we identify pieces of artwork located elsewhere in the collection or with the purchase of new pieces.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collections contains 51 pieces of artwork. A majoirty of the 51 pieces are portraits, but the collection also includes architectural drawings and a bust.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arragned by physical location and includes 12 series and 3 sub-series.

defitem.label: Series 3:
defitem.item: Rare Book Room Flat Files, 1857, 1901, undated

defitem.label: Series 4:
defitem.item: First Floor Stacks Flat Files, 1865, 1869, 1998, undated

did.unittitle: Pilgrim Society Certificate of Thomas M. Boss

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: This is the only signed architectural rendering by Thomas Dawes, a prominent Boston architect of the eigteenth century. It shows a set of commercial buildings, to be erected on the corner of Marlborough (now Washington) and Milk Streets. Dawes later gained fame as a patriot during the Revolutionary War. One of the Old South papers, on permanent loan to the Congregational Library.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: This is a reproduction of the work by Peter Pelham.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: For both preservation and display purposes, many of the pieces of artwork have been framed. Framed pieces at the CLA will not be removed from their frames without the express permission of the Executive Director.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by Mary Lou Mayfield in August, 2020; accession 2020-09. Originally assigned identification number MS5414 before it was merged into this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Zachary Bodnar, November 2020, using DACS second edition. Item was incorporated into the Congregational Library and Archives Artwork Collection in June 2023.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nancy E. Forsberg was born on August 5, 1922 in Jersey City and moved to Maplewood, New Jersey in 1926. She graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Denison University and worked as an educator in Ohio and worked at the YWCA In Connecticut. She graduated from Yale University School of Divinity in 1951 and was ordained the same year; she was one of only three women who graduated from the divinity school that year. She later graduated with a masters in education from New York University. She returned to Maplewood and became pastor of the First Congregational Church in Union, New Jersey, in 1967. While serving as pastor, Rev. Nancy became a leader in interfaith and interracial efforts; she is credited with helping to bring Holocaust studies into Union-area schools. She also led an interfaith Bus Ministry which brought groups of people on spiritually focused trips across the United States, Canada, Europe, and Israel. She served as the pastor of the First Congregational Church, now the Faith United Church of Christ, until her retirement in 2000. She died on April 5, 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a single portrait of Nancy E. Forsburg. The portrait was created by an unknow artist in 1998. Portrait is, likely, charcoal on paper.

corpname.part: Faith United Church of Christ (Union (Union County, N.J.))
